alert.note: Alert for Custer (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 15 at 12:14PM MDT until June 18 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Billings MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Miles City affecting Custer County. .Flood waters moving through the Yellowstone River will begin impacting Custer County and the Miles City area over the next 36 to 48 hours. Areas along the Yellowstone River can expect minor flooding, especially low lying areas immediate to the river. For the Yellowstone River...including Miles City...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO SATURDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Yellowstone River at Miles City. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM MDT Wednesday the stage was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Thursday evening to a crest of 14.8 feet Friday morning. It will then fall below flood stage Friday night. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.7 feet on 05/24/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Yellowstone River Miles City 14.0 11.7 Wed 11 am 13.2 14.8 12.4 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Safety message...A river Flood Warning means river flooding is expected to impact people and property in the warned area. Prepare for flooding impacts associated with the forecast river levels in your location. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Thursday afternoon at 1215 PM MDT.
